<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>If you're looking for a soundtrack at work today, we suggest Jay-Z. The music mogul is celebrating his 50th birthday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>When we reached out to Jay with congratulations, he responded, "Thank you, thank you, thank you, you're far too kind."</span></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/03/googles-double-ogs-step-alphabet?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Google’s Double OGs Step Down
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Google's cofounders" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc1NDEzMzYzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Kim Kulish/Corbis via Getty Images. Look at these two.</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Larry Page and Sergey Brin penned the equivalent of your mom’s Facebook essay when you graduated college. The Google cofounders announced they’re <a href="https://blog.google/inside-google/alphabet/letter-from-larry-and-sergey?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stepping down</a> as Alphabet CEO and president, respectively, and ready to “assume the role of proud parents—offering advice and love, but not daily nagging!” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sundar Pichai, the CEO of Google, will also become the boss of parent company Alphabet. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Some quick reminiscing</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You can thank Page and Brin for glamorizing the idea of <a href="https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/197848?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">starting</a> a business in a hot California garage and naming it something funny. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The pair built a technology empire worth nearly $900 billion. It’s expanded from just indexing information on the internet to building driverless vehicles, wi-fi balloons, and Android, the operating system powering about 85% of smartphones.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Page and Brin assumed their most recent roles in 2015 when Google <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2015/08/10/431388769/google-creates-new-parent-company-called-alphabet?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reorganized</a> and created Alphabet as its parent company. In “retirement,” Brin and Page will remain involved as board members and shareholders and continue to eat up Pichai’s data plan with twice-weekly nagging. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">On Pichai’s to-do list</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Solve the workplace conflicts eating away at morale. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Four Google employees who were <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-25/google-fires-four-employees-citing-data-security-violations?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fired</a> last week for alleged data security violations are filing a complaint with the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) <a href="https://medium.com/@GoogleWalkout/google-fired-us-for-organizing-were-fighting-back-d0daa8113aed?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">accusing</a> Google of unfairly punishing them for their organizing efforts. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>During his tenure as CEO, Pichai’s dealt with increasingly vocal Googlers upset with their employer. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Those complaints include treatment of contract workers, failure to address sexual harassment, attempts to build a censored Chinese search engine, and treatment of LGBTQ workers, to name a few. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In response, Google recently <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/20/technology/Google-union-consultant.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hired</a> a consulting firm known for snuffing out unionization, and Pichai <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/15/20966718/google-weekly-all-hands-tgif-staff-meeting-changes-ceo-sundar-pichai?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suspended</a> the company's famous weekly all-hands meetings in favor of monthly sit-downs focused on “product and business strategy.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This could be the NLRB’s second run-in with Google this year. </strong>In September, the labor board <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/12/national-labor-relations-board-encouraging-political-talk-google?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">addressed</a> complaints that Google was stifling political chatter at work. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/03/trumps-trade-tweets-rock-boat?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Trump Towers Over Stock Market
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday at the NATO summit in London, President Trump <a href="https://apnews.com/fbfc4c93ff424225b36c20527166fb08?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suggested</a> he was willing to wait until after the 2020 election in November to complete a trade deal with China. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Stocks </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-02/asian-stocks-to-drop-on-tariff-jitters-u-s-data-markets-wrap?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dipped</a></span><span> while safer assets like gold, bonds, and the Japanese yen jumped. Trade-sensitive sectors like energy and tech were hit especially hard. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Longtime Brew readers know that markets have been particularly sensitive to Trump tweets. JPMorgan even <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-09/jpmorgan-creates-volfefe-index-to-track-trump-tweet-impact?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">created the "Volfefe Index"</a> to measure how the president's Twitter musings affect Treasury yields.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But in the past few months, markets appeared to have <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/03/business/stocks-fall-trump-china-trade-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">developed</a> a sticks and stones mentality on their way to record highs.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This week is a different story </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While a phase one trade deal seems unlikely, a phase 15 trade escalation is around the corner: 15% tariffs are scheduled to hit $160 billion in Chinese goods on Dec. 15. Because this volley is targeted at everyday items like smartphones, laptops, and shoes, economists worry it could hamstring consumer spending, a sector that’s propped up the economy. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/03/us-students-perform-poorly-global-exam?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
U.S. Students Have Some Homework to Do
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="school of rock " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/XyOrJljDNBEpa/giphy.gif">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">American teenagers are trailing their Asian peers in reading, math, and science. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s what the Program for International Student Assessment (PISA) <a href="http://www.oecd.org/pisa/PISA%202018%20Insights%20and%20Interpretations%20FINAL%20PDF.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">found</a> in its 2018 exam. The test is administered every three years to 15-year-olds across 79 education systems.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>Countries with the highest-performing students will be the most prepared to compete in the global economy. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>China topped the list in all three subjects, while Singapore came in second place. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The U.S. ranked eighth in reading, 11th in science, and 30th in math. In reading and math, </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-students-fail-to-make-gains-against-international-peers-11575360000?mod=hp_lista_pos5&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the gap</a></span><span> between higher- and lower-performing American students widened from previous years. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This is a flex and a half for the Chinese educational system. In the four regions of China that were tested, the level of income was “<a href="https://www.scmp.com/week-asia/lifestyle-culture/article/3040366/mainland-chinese-students-best-world-singapore-hong?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">well below</a>” the average in wealthy countries, and they still crushed the U.S.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some experts <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/education/us-students-continue-to-lag-behind-peers-in-east-asia-and-europe-in-reading-math-and-science-exams-show/2019/12/02/e9e3b37c-153d-11ea-9110-3b34ce1d92b1_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cautioned</a> the U.S. shouldn’t panic since American students are less motivated to perform well on the test.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But...maybe that’s the heart of the problem?</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COURTROOM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/03/musk-testifies-trial-pedo-guy-tweet?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Elon Reads Mean Tweets
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sentences we didn’t expect to write: Tesla CEO Elon Musk <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/03/elon-musk-testifies-in-vern-unsworth-pedo-guy-trial.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">testified</a> yesterday in a defamation suit brought against him by British cave explorer Vernon Unsworth, whom Musk called “pedo guy” in a 2018 tweet. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>After 12 boys and their soccer coach were trapped in a flooded Thailand cave last year, Musk <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/07/10/world/asia/elon-musk-thailand-cave-submarine.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">offered</a> a mini-submarine to help with the rescue efforts. The “PR stunt” irritated Unsworth, one of the rescue divers, and he gave Musk suggestions about where to put his submarine. Cue this now-deleted tweet:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://i.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/001/411/899/5f5.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><a href="https://knowyourmeme.com/photos/1411899-elon-musk?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>@elonmusk</em></a></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Musk apologized to Unsworth...but then <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/aug/29/elon-musk-doubles-down-on-pedo-claims-against-uk-cave-diver?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doubled</a> and even <a href="https://fortune.com/2018/09/04/elon-musk-pedo-tweet-pedophilia-accusations-diver/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tripled</a> down on his previous insinuations. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The lawsuit </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just over a year ago, Unsworth <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/02/media/elon-musk-defamation-tweet/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sued</a> Musk, who tried and failed to get the case dismissed. In testimony yesterday, Musk said, “There are a lot of things I say, and not all of them have the same quality of thought...not everything can be thoughtful.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Musk’s unpredictable behavior has landed him in trouble with investors, regulators, and <a href="https://giphy.com/gifs/truck-tesla-pickup-gLREH1v1Z78tJckuii/fullscreen?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">window repairmen</a>. Unsworth has to prove Musk acted with “actual malice” to get the case to stick.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/03/chicago-real-estate-prices-slide?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Trouble in the 312
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="RCA chart of price trends " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc1NDA5NjQ2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.rcanalytics.com/chart-prices-metros-us-canada/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Real Capital Analytics</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Office, industrial, retail, and apartment property values have mostly been <a href="https://www.rcanalytics.com/chart-prices-metros-us-canada/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on the up</a> in major North American metros since the financial crisis, Real Capital Analytics (RCA) reports. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But...not in Chicago. Prices in the region fell 4.1% over the past year, a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/chicago-property-prices-stagnate-trail-even-crisis-stricken-hong-kong-11575374402?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bigger drop</a> than in Hong Kong, which has been engulfed in protests since the summer. In Chicago's home of Cook County, IL, deal volume is down 42% year-to-date.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The Chicago Bears: </strong></span><span>Real estate investors are worried as state and local governments stare down huge pension liabilities. They’re expecting already-high taxes to increase. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The Chicago Bulls:</strong></span><span> Other investors see opportunity in discount prices, the WSJ notes. After all, the city is growing as an employment center, with tech job openings in November up over 20% annually.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>“There is nothing wrong with Chicagoland, investors simply hate uncertainty,” <a href="https://www.rcanalytics.com/whats-wrong-in-chicagoland/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a> RCA SVP Jim Costello.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

FROM THE CREW
</h3>
</td>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Morning Brew team members have three things in common:</strong> They're passionate about their work, they support each other’s ideas, and they can’t keep office plants alive. Unlike our plants, we’re growing fast and looking for all-stars to fill the following roles:</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://jobs.lever.co/morningbrew/9936b7ee-0d9e-424f-8f43-e2e5b4e112a1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Audio Producer</a>: We’ve got one great podcast now. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://jobs.lever.co/morningbrew?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apply to those roles and others here</a>. </p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nC-SUITE \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/03/googles-double-ogs-step-alphabet?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nGoogle’s Double OGs Step Down\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Google's cofounders\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc1NDEzMzYzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eKim Kulish/Corbis via Getty Images. Look at these two.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Larry Page and Sergey Brin penned the equivalent of your mom’s Facebook essay when you graduated college. The Google cofounders announced they’re \u003ca href=\"https://blog.google/inside-google/alphabet/letter-from-larry-and-sergey?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estepping down\u003c/a\u003e as Alphabet CEO and president, respectively, and ready to “assume the role of proud parents—offering advice and love, but not daily nagging!” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSundar Pichai, the CEO of Google, will also become the boss of parent company Alphabet. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSome quick reminiscing\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou can thank Page and Brin for glamorizing the idea of \u003ca href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/197848?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estarting\u003c/a\u003e a business in a hot California garage and naming it something funny. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe pair built a technology empire worth nearly $900 billion. It’s expanded from just indexing information on the internet to building driverless vehicles, wi-fi balloons, and Android, the operating system powering about 85% of smartphones.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePage and Brin assumed their most recent roles in 2015 when Google \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2015/08/10/431388769/google-creates-new-parent-company-called-alphabet?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereorganized\u003c/a\u003e and created Alphabet as its parent company. In “retirement,” Brin and Page will remain involved as board members and shareholders and continue to eat up Pichai’s data plan with twice-weekly nagging. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOn Pichai’s to-do list\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSolve the workplace conflicts eating away at morale. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFour Google employees who were \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-25/google-fires-four-employees-citing-data-security-violations?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efired\u003c/a\u003e last week for alleged data security violations are filing a complaint with the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) \u003ca href=\"https://medium.com/@GoogleWalkout/google-fired-us-for-organizing-were-fighting-back-d0daa8113aed?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccusing\u003c/a\u003e Google of unfairly punishing them for their organizing efforts. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eDuring his tenure as CEO, Pichai’s dealt with increasingly vocal Googlers upset with their employer. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThose complaints include treatment of contract workers, failure to address sexual harassment, attempts to build a censored Chinese search engine, and treatment of LGBTQ workers, to name a few. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn response, Google recently \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/20/technology/Google-union-consultant.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehired\u003c/a\u003e a consulting firm known for snuffing out unionization, and Pichai \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/15/20966718/google-weekly-all-hands-tgif-staff-meeting-changes-ceo-sundar-pichai?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuspended\u003c/a\u003e the company's famous weekly all-hands meetings in favor of monthly sit-downs focused on “product and business strategy.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThis could be the NLRB’s second run-in with Google this year. \u003c/strong\u003eIn September, the labor board \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/12/national-labor-relations-board-encouraging-political-talk-google?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaddressed\u003c/a\u003e complaints that Google was stifling political chatter at work. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nTrump Towers Over Stock Market\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday at the NATO summit in London, President Trump \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/fbfc4c93ff424225b36c20527166fb08?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuggested\u003c/a\u003e he was willing to wait until after the 2020 election in November to complete a trade deal with China. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eStocks \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-02/asian-stocks-to-drop-on-tariff-jitters-u-s-data-markets-wrap?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edipped\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e while safer assets like gold, bonds, and the Japanese yen jumped. Trade-sensitive sectors like energy and tech were hit especially hard. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eLongtime Brew readers know that markets have been particularly sensitive to Trump tweets. JPMorgan even \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-09/jpmorgan-creates-volfefe-index-to-track-trump-tweet-impact?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecreated the \"Volfefe Index\"\u003c/a\u003e to measure how the president's Twitter musings affect Treasury yields.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut in the past few months, markets appeared to have \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/03/business/stocks-fall-trump-china-trade-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeveloped\u003c/a\u003e a sticks and stones mentality on their way to record highs.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis week is a different story \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile a phase one trade deal seems unlikely, a phase 15 trade escalation is around the corner: 15% tariffs are scheduled to hit $160 billion in Chinese goods on Dec. 15. Because this volley is targeted at everyday items like smartphones, laptops, and shoes, economists worry it could hamstring consumer spending, a sector that’s propped up the width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmerican teenagers are trailing their Asian peers in reading, math, and science. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s what the Program for International Student Assessment (PISA) \u003ca href=\"http://www.oecd.org/pisa/PISA%202018%20Insights%20and%20Interpretations%20FINAL%20PDF.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efound\u003c/a\u003e in its 2018 exam. The test is administered every three years to 15-year-olds across 79 education systems.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eCountries with the highest-performing students will be the most prepared to compete in the global economy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eChina topped the list in all three subjects, while Singapore came in second place. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. ranked eighth in reading, 11th in science, and 30th in math. In reading and math, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-students-fail-to-make-gains-against-international-peers-11575360000?mod=hp_lista_pos5\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe gap\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e between higher- and lower-performing American students widened from previous years. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is a flex and a half for the Chinese educational system. In the four regions of China that were tested, the level of income was “\u003ca href=\"https://www.scmp.com/week-asia/lifestyle-culture/article/3040366/mainland-chinese-students-best-world-singapore-hong?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewell below\u003c/a\u003e” the average in wealthy countries, and they still crushed the U.S.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome experts \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/education/us-students-continue-to-lag-behind-peers-in-east-asia-and-europe-in-reading-math-and-science-exams-show/2019/12/02/e9e3b37c-153d-11ea-9110-3b34ce1d92b1_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecautioned\u003c/a\u003e the U.S. shouldn’t panic since American students are less motivated to perform well on the test.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut...maybe that’s the heart of the style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSentences we didn’t expect to write: Tesla CEO Elon Musk \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/03/elon-musk-testifies-in-vern-unsworth-pedo-guy-trial.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etestified\u003c/a\u003e yesterday in a defamation suit brought against him by British cave explorer Vernon Unsworth, whom Musk called “pedo guy” in a 2018 tweet. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter 12 boys and their soccer coach were trapped in a flooded Thailand cave last year, Musk \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2018/07/10/world/asia/elon-musk-thailand-cave-submarine.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoffered\u003c/a\u003e a mini-submarine to help with the rescue efforts. The “PR stunt” irritated Unsworth, one of the rescue divers, and he gave Musk suggestions about where to put his submarine. Cue this now-deleted tweet:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/001/411/899/5f5.jpg\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup class=\"sub-text\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://knowyourmeme.com/photos/1411899-elon-musk?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e@elonmusk\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMusk apologized to Unsworth...but then \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/aug/29/elon-musk-doubles-down-on-pedo-claims-against-uk-cave-diver?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edoubled\u003c/a\u003e and even \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2018/09/04/elon-musk-pedo-tweet-pedophilia-accusations-diver/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etripled\u003c/a\u003e down on his previous insinuations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe lawsuit \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJust over a year ago, Unsworth \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/02/media/elon-musk-defamation-tweet/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esued\u003c/a\u003e Musk, who tried and failed to get the case dismissed. In testimony yesterday, Musk said, “There are a lot of things I say, and not all of them have the same quality of thought...not everything can be thoughtful.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eMusk’s unpredictable behavior has landed him in trouble with investors, regulators, and \u003ca href=\"https://giphy.com/gifs/truck-tesla-pickup-gLREH1v1Z78tJckuii/fullscreen?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewindow repairmen\u003c/a\u003e.
